page.title: 14Games We Play
page.content: At our school, children in the first year play "Hopscotch," "What time is it Mr Wolf" and "Leapfrog." The fourth year girls also play "Hopscotch" but the boys do not take part.They play basketball, football or throw a tennis ball around in teams. To play "What time is it Mr Wolf" you need someone to be "Wolf" at the top end of the yard. He turns his back on them and they keep asking the time as they walk towards him, stepping out the number he has said. When he turns around they have not to let him see them moving otherwise they are out. The first person to touch him on the back then becomes "Wolf." Sometimes the "Wolf" will chase after us once he is touched on the back and has to try to catch one of us before we get back to safety.
